How I fixed my BrizTechVR Google Cardboard V2 lens issues

Apr 16, 2018

This week I ordered the BrizTechVR Google Cardboard V2. These are not the original Google Cardboard but since this is basically cardboard, the guys from BrizTechVR followed the specifications for both the first and the V2 version.

You can’t expect a incredible quality tech product for 20€, but the improvments from the first version are worthy (there are some <30€ non-cardboard versions with really good reviews). The V2 version now it comes with a push button (no more magnets) and it’s ready to handle large screen devices.

The problem

The QR code that set the lens config wasn’t working properly

I tried them on both Android and iOS to check the marketplaces and see what was available. At the end, the Cardboard app has some good recommendations. My favorite one is VRSE. It’s not a game but a platform for VR storytelling.

I started watching the NYT Walking in New York documentary but suddenly what I was viewing was wrong. It wasn’t correctly centered. I was able to correctly view the video by closing one eye… so I guessed that the QR code that has the configuration settings wasn’t working properly. Actually, I tried some other games and it worked perfectly.

The solution

Creating a custom lens config did the trick

Turns out that I wasn’t the only one having this kind of problems.

All the software that uses the Cardboard SDK are able to change the lens config. This allows everyone to make his own cardboard and then just generate a Viewer Profile.

To generate the viewer profile we need to pair the phone and the browser by accessing an specific URL that the profile generator give us.

Basically I changed the main parameters like this:

And finally… the generated QR code if you want to try it:

Never settle.
